name: Denali
hint: The highest peak in North America at 6,190 meters, located in central Alaska

name: Mount Logan
hint: Canada's highest mountain and the second-highest peak in North America, in the Yukon

name: Pico de Orizaba
hint: Mexico's highest peak, a dormant volcano also known as Citlaltepetl, in eastern Mexico

name: Mount Rainier
hint: The highest mountain in Washington state, an active stratovolcano in the Cascade Range

name: Mount Whitney
hint: The highest peak in the contiguous United States, located in California's Sierra Nevada

name: Mount Elbert
hint: The highest peak in the Rocky Mountains and in Colorado, a popular hiking destination

name: Mount Mitchell
hint: The highest peak east of the Mississippi River, located in North Carolina's Appalachian Mountains

name: Mauna Kea
hint: A dormant volcano in Hawaii, the tallest mountain on Earth when measured from its oceanic base

name: Grand Teton
hint: The highest peak in the Teton Range of Wyoming, a dramatic granite peak in a famous national park

name: Mount Hood
hint: Oregon's highest peak, a potentially active stratovolcano in the Cascade Range near Portland
